Technique: HEWN; LOW RELIEF; HIGH RELIEF; ENGRAVED
Name: A false-door stele of Rekhi
Description: The false door stele of Rekhi, which probably dates to the 6th Dynasty, is characterised by a repetition of the figures and the texts. The "Lector-Priest" and palace official are represented on the  interior and exterior jambs  in a striding  pose,  looking towards the central axis of the door. He is holding in his hands a long staff and a xxxx- sceptre. On the panel in the middle of the monument, he is represented seated before an offering-table .  The stele is surmounted by a cornice composed of stylised palms.
